parameters.definition: Amount of fruit required to produce one unit of wine
Amount of water required to produce one unit of wine
Amount of fruit required to produce one unit of kombucha
Amount of tea required to produce one unit of kombucha
Minimum proportion of kombucha in the product mix

description: A brewery can ferment their product into either wine or kombucha. Each unit of wine requires \param{FruitWine} units of fruit and \param{WaterWine} units of water. Each unit of kombucha requires \param{FruitKombucha} units of fruit and \param{TeaKombucha} units of tea. The company has available \param{WaterAvailable} units of water and \param{TeaAvailable} units of tea. Wine sells for more, therefore the number of wine must be larger than the number of kombucha. Additionally, at least \param{MinKombuchaProp} of their products made must be kombucha. How many of each should the brewery make to minimize the total units of fruit required?
